meanings.sent1: Without exercise, muscles can atrophy and become weak.
meanings.sent2: If you don't use your brain, it may atrophy over time.
meanings.sent3: The neglected plant began to atrophy, longing for sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams seemed to atrophy, fading into the background.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting to practice the piano caused her skills to atrophy.

meanings.definition: A wasting away or deterioration, especially of body tissue
meanings.sent1: The doctor observed muscle atrophy in the patient's leg.
meanings.sent2: The atrophy of the skin was a result of prolonged exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent3: The abandoned house showed signs of atrophy, with peeling paint and sagging roof.
meanings.sent4: The atrophy of the old building symbolized the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The atrophy of the fruit was evident from its shriveled appearance.

meanings.definition: A decrease in size or strength, often due to lack of use
meanings.sent1: The atrophy of his skills was noticeable after years of inactivity.
meanings.sent2: The atrophy of the company was attributed to poor management.
meanings.sent3: The atrophy of the once bustling street was a sad sight.
meanings.sent4: The atrophy of relationships can occur when communication breaks down.
meanings.sent5: The atrophy of the bridge's support beams led to its collapse.
